turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Korean Traditional Rhythm.
turn.1: What is the difference between Jangdan and Yonga ?
turn.2: If one beat is considered as a half note, the Jangdan is a 10/2 beat tempo, and if considered a quarter note, the Jangdan is a 10/8+8+8 beat tempo.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Sometime it is considered 20 beat tempo for very slow music.
turn.5: Which one is used in most songs?
turn.6: The Sang-Young-San Jangdan is used in the first and middle part of the Young-San-Hoe-Sang(靈山會相), 1~3 chapter of Yeo-Min-Rak(與民樂), 1~4 chapter of Bo-Heo-Sa/Bo-Heo-Ja(步虛子).
turn.7: Are the two types of rhythm used in the same songs?
turn.8: Se -Ryoung-San Jangdan is a 10 beat tempo, similar to Sang-Young-San Jangdan, but a bit faster so it has many variations.
turn.9: What are some songs in which Se-ryoung-san was used?
turn.10: It is used in Se-young-San in Young-San-Hoe-Sang, Ga-Rak-Deo-Ri, 4~7 chapter of Yeo-Min-Rak, and 5~7 chapter of Bo-Heo-Sa/Bo-Heo-Ja(步虛子).
turn.11: Are there any other types of rhythm?
turn.12: Doduri Jangdan is the most used Jangdan in Jeong-Ak(formal music), a 6 beat tempo in normal speed.
